brute-forcing is when you have something encrypted and you can't figure out how to decrypt it, so you try out every possible combination, even though that might take weeks. And indexing is where you have a collection of data, typically an "array" or a "list", then each element in that collection resides on its own index
Do not know who this mystery guitar man is.
Nice surprise to see MysteryGuitarMan on SED right after watched MGM's vid :P

Indexing in programming is borrowed from the idea of index cards in a library. Say you have the group [apple, orange, banana]: apple=0, orange=1, banana=2. Just a handy way to deal with groups of things that you need to access in a specific order.

Brute forcing is exactly what it sounds like. Trading being smart about it for overpowering it. For example removing a door with a sledge hammer instead of a screwdriver.
